results.title: Live sheep export to Iran
results.brief_description:
Shows sheep being wormed, branded and fed on a farm before focusing on the modified oil tankers that eventually take them to Iran.

Music throughout is an up-beat synthesised piece with a middle eastern bent.

results.title: On the land (i)
results.brief_description:
Fast-paced montage of general farm and animal imagery. Seems to be the title sequence for a television series. Ends with a superimposed title. End of reel features an alternative superimposition that reads ‘On the Land S-TV8’.
Soundtrack is comprised solely of up-beat orchestral music.

results.title: A Working holiday
results.creator_credit: Jack Keane and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Hop picking in Victoria; seasonal workers gather from all parts of Australia for six weeks to harvest hops in the rich Ovens Valley. Shows the picking, bagging and weighing of the bags, and transport to the kilns. The weekend break is spent swimming, fishing or sight-seeing in the surrounding Alps.

results.title: Phalaris seed retention
results.brief_description:
In order to negate Phelaris crops from losing their ‘top’ before harvesting, crop-dusting is employed.

Features good footage of plane flying over crops and releasing chemicals.

Largely comprises of an interview between a presenter and a scientist.

results.title: One hundred harvests
results.brief_description: Soundtrack currently not matched with picture. Quality violin music at begining, before the histroy of wheat farming in victoria is delivered through narration. It closes with a gentle orchestral piece that lasts around 60 seconds.

results.title: Picking grapes
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Jack Keane
results.brief_description: Shot close to the Murry river. Predominantly features instructional sequences on how to pick and process grapes. Nice shots featuring contrasting Orange and Green colours in the soil/grapes. Four soundtracks accompany picture; Italian, German, English and Hungarian.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Jack Keane

results.title: Centenary of Bright
results.brief_description:
Begins with landscape shots outside of Bright, before focusing on the centenary celebrations, including crowds and reinactments of life in Bright 100 years ago. Film then follows a parade, highlighting the numerous floats involved.

Good footage of 20m high tress being cut down as part of a carnival.

Deputy Premier A.G Rylah unviels the Bright centenary Cairn, gives speech about the importnace of young people in a community.

Film nicely shot, with vibrant colours.

results.title: Pleuro
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture, Ann Millard and Jack Keane
results.brief_description:
Film made to alert farmers of Pleuro-Pneoumonia, a nothern-state illness that could cripple local cattle if it was introduced into Victoria. Details how the illness manifests itself in cattle, its symptoms and how it is treated. Also describes the process of quarantine if Pleuro is suspected.

Uses diagramatical animations and illustrations throughout. These feature an animated map of Australia and Victoria. Numerous shots of cattle in hot and dry conditions. Amongst other bloody imagery there is footage of organs being removed from diseased cow and placed in a tin. Nice cheesey sequence of quarantine signs being placed around a property. Good ‘The End’ title.

results.title: On the land (ii)
results.brief_description: Montage of colourful shots including a streetscape, livestock and grapepicking. Attractive illustrated title. Sound consists solely of a theme song. The music is upbeat, cheesey and evocative of television programmes of the 1970s and 1980s. Good countdown at begining, some numbers written as words, ie ‘six’ not ‘6’.

results.title: Melbourne (no. 3)
results.brief_description: Film features quite general shots of Melbourne in the summer. This includes footage of the Great Ocean Road (including panoramas), a busy suburban pool and St. Kilda Beach. These sequences have a great, nostalgic ‘good time’ vibe to them, which is aided in part by the high-contrast film stock. There is also footage of one of Melbourne’s Gardens (possibly the Botanic), including blooming flowers and people looking at them. Nice shots of man burning leaves followed by the sun breaking through smoke haze and trees in garden. Two shots include views of St. Paul’s Cathederal and the Forum Theatre from the Yarra. Nice, Black and White ‘The End’.
